# Parallels Plesk

The Parallels Plesk Panel (ex: Parallels Plesk Control Panel, Plesk Server Administrator, PSA or just Plesk) software package is a commercial web hosting automation program. Originally released under the U.S. company Plesk Inc. and designed in Novosibirsk, Russia, Plesk was acquired by SWSoft in July 2003. SWSoft renamed themselves under the Parallels name (a brand which had been acquired by SWSoft) in 2008.

Main Site : http://www.parallels.com/products/plesk/

Parallels Plesk Panel - Demos : Demo site

The default port of plesk control panel is 8443.

## How to see Server Statistics

- Login to Plesk control panel as admin
- Click on Tools & Settings from the left side menu.
- Then select Server Information under Server Management. Then you will get current statistics of your server.

## How to restart Services from Plesk

- Login to Plesk control panel as admin
- Click on Tools & Settings from the left side menu.
- Then select Services management under Server Management. 
- In the new window you can see the status of your service and can restart services

## How to Modify DNS Settings of a Domain

You can modify DNS records like A, CNAME, MX, NS etc of a domain from plesk DNS settings.

- login to Plesk as admin.
- Go to Domains and open Manage Hosting interface.
- Select Websites & Domains from menu and then click on DNS Settings . The current DNS zone file should be open in the next window.
   - Click Switch OFF/ON DNS Service button to enable/disable dns service on this particular domain 
  - Click on Add Record to add new records to the current domain dns zone file.
  
## How to Enable / Create FTP Accounts

- login to Plesk as admin.
- Go to Domains and open Manage Hosting interface.
- Select Websites & Domains from menu and then click on FTP Access.
- Then click on Create Additional FTP Account  to create new FTP accounts under your account
- In the new window write your FTP account name, select the Home directory, put password and select quota and permission.
- Then click on OK button to setup FTP account.

## How to Install Web Apps on your account

You can install web apps like wordpress, joomla, etc from the plesk control panel.

- login to Plesk as admin.
- Go to Domains and open Manage Hosting interface.
- Select Websites & Domains from menu and then click on Applications 
- Select the web apps application and then click on Install button. Then continue with the installation steps.

## Password Protected Directory from Plesk

**Create Password Protected Directory**

- login to Plesk as admin.
- Go to Domains and open Manage Hosting interface.
- Select Websites & Domains from menu and then click on Show Advanced Operations  and then click on Password-protected Directories

```diagram

```

- In the next window click on Add Protected Directory button.
- Put your directory name you want to protect and put a title for that protected directory (optional). Then click on OK button. 

Now you can see that directory under Protected directories.

- Now click on that directory.
- In the next window click on Add New User
- Write your username and password and then click on OK button
 
You are done. Now try to access that directory via browser. It will give you a login prompt to enter your username and password.

**Remove Password Protected Diretory**

- Select the directory you want to remove and then click on Remove button

## Plesk File Manager

- login to Plesk as admin.
- Go to Domains and open Manage Hosting interface.
- Select Websites & Domains from menu and then click on File Manager
- Now click on httpdocs folder (which is the default document root folder). Now you can add/upload/edit/delete files, create new folder, create archive, etc...

## How to change root password from Plesk

1. Log in to your Plesk admin account.
1. Click on the “Server” link on the left and then click on “Change Password.”
1. Enter your current root password and enter in a new password twice. Click on the “Save” or “Apply Settings” button and the password settings are saved.

## How to Stop Ngnix from Plesk

Follow the procedure to stop ngnix reverse proxy

- Log on to Plesk 
- Go to Tools & Setting 
- Open Service management 
- Stop ngnix service from plesk

## How to Configure PHP run as ISAPI Extension

**Configure PHP run as ISAPI Extension**

ISAPI extensions are true applications that run on IIS and have access to all of the functionality provided by IIS. If a windows customer report his PHP is slow, the one possible reason is he is using other type like CGI instead of ISAPI . He can change it from from the plesk. On windows it should be configured as ISAPI Extension which is more compatible to IIs

- Login to plesk
- Go to Domains » Domain Name » Domain Control panel » Websites&Domains » Click on the Domain name
- Under Web Scripting and Statistics ,change the PHP run type to “ISAPI Extension”

## How to Enable Domain Administration Access

To activate the domain administration panel from plesk, please follow the steps

1. Login to plesk admin panel.
1. Click Domains » Then Click on Domain name you want to active Domain Administration
1. Below on the new window , you can see a section for “Domain Administration”
1. Click on ” Domain Administrator Access” , configure the settings and save the settings
1. Load https://domain.com:8443 . Username should be domain.com and password the new one you configured in Step 4.


## How to Add Cron Jobs / Scheduled Task from Plesk Panel

- login to Plesk as admin.
- Go to Domains and open Manage Hosting interface.
- Select Websites & Domains from menu and then click on Show Advanced Operations  and then click on Scheduled Task.
- Then click on System Username and then click on Schedule New Task button under Tools.
- From the new window make sure you selected Switch ON option and then fill up details with necessary in formation
- Then click on OK to schedule that or click on Run Now to run that cron job right now.
